info.title: Aircall
info.description:
Aircall Public API is a classic REST API. It can be used with any programming languages and offers a fast, reliable and secure access to an Aircall account information.
Each Public API request must be authenticated and should not exceed the rate limit, please check the Authentication and the rate limiting sections before jumping in our documentation!

get.description: Retrieve details of a specific User.

put.description: Some fields can be updated via the Public API. For instance, a User's availability status could be automatically updated based on information from their calendar or a workforce management tool.

204.description: User will be deleted in the next minutes, depending on how many calls and data are associated to them.

422.description: Server unable to process the request, error will be described in the troubleshoot field.

delete.description: When deleting a User, all data associated to them will also be destroyed and won't be recoverable.

requestBody.description: Post the necessary fields for the API to create a new user.

post.description: Users can be created one at a time. After creation, a unique user ID will be included in the response's payload. An invitation email will be sent to the User, they will have to confirm their account before being able to use Aircall.

get.description: Fetch all Users associated to a Company and their information.
List the detailed availability of all Users, displayed in the Dashboard's Activity Feed.

Fetch all Calls associated to a company and their information.

By default, Calls are ordered by ascending IDs - consider using the order=desc query param if you want to get the last calls made by an account!

Only six months of history is available. Please contact our Support team on support.aircall.io to get a one-time export of calls.

Retrieve the detailed availability of a specific User, displayed in the Dashboard's Activity Feed.

Please refer to the User object definition to see all the possible values of the availability field.

Use this endpoint to asynchronously retrieve a Call data like duration, direction, status, timestamps, comments or tagsâ€¦

To get Calls information in real time, we recommend using Calls Webhooks events - for instance to log information automatically in your database after a Call.

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description: Direction of the Calls. If specified, can be inbound or outbound.

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: Unique ID of the User who made or received Calls.

parameters.name: phone_number
parameters.description: The calling or receiving phone number of Calls.

400.description:
Call already ended.
Call cannot be transferred to a team with more than 25 users.
Invalid usage of dispatching strategy with user or external phone number.

post.description:
Calls can be transferred to another User, Team or phone number.

Only cold transfers are available via the Public API:

To transfer a Call to another User, provide a user ID in the request's body. A call.transferred Webhook event will be sent.
If the agent to whom the call was transferred to is not available, call will be directed to the No one answers strategy: the Unanswered call message will be played.

To transfer a Call to a Team, provide a team ID in the request's body. A call.transferred Webhook event will be sent. When transferring a call to a team dispatching strategy can be specified with parameter: dispatching_strategy: The "simultaneous" strategy (default one if argument is not specified) will ring each available members simultaneously. The "random" one will ring each available member one by one.
When call is ringing, transferring to a team is limited to teams with 25 users or less.

To transfer an Incoming Call to an external phone number, provide a phone number in the request body. When transfer is initiated, a message will be played to the caller informing them that their call is being transferred. Also, no Webhook event will be sent in that scenario.
Transfers to external phone numbers will only work for inbound calls that have not yet been answered.

user_id.description: Unique identifier of the User the Call will be transferred to.

team_id.description: Unique identifier of the Team the Call will be transferred to.

number.description: External phone number the Call will be transferred to. Format must be e164. More information in the dedicated phone numbers format section.

dispatching_strategy.description: Specify dispatching strategy on team transfer, only values 'random' and simultaneous are accepted. This parameter is optional if not specified "simultaneous" strategy is implicitly used.

400.description: Maximum of 5 notes can be added to a Call.

post.description:
Comments (also called Notes) can be added to Calls and a Call can have a maximum of five of them. After five comments added, those requests will fail with a 400 HTTP code. A comment posted via the Public API does not have an owner.

Once a Comment is posted on a Call, it cannot be updated nor deleted.

Tags are created in the Dashboard by Admins and calls can be tagged by Agent from the Phone.

Once a Tag is associated to a Call, it cannot be removed.

put.description: Missed calls non-archived will be displayed in the To-do view and can be Mark as done (= archived).

get.description: Archived calls can be placed back in the To-do view of the Phone app.

405.description: Recording is disabled on the Call's number.

post.description: When live recording is actived on a Call, it can be automatically paused via the Public API.

405.description: Recording is disabled on the Call's Number.

delete.description:
Delete the recording of a specific Call. It takes between 10 and 15 minutes to delete a call recording from our servers.

This action cannot be undone.

Delete the voicemail of a specific Call. It can take up to 1 minute to delete a call voicemail from our servers.

This action cannot be undone.

post.description:
Insight Cards display custom data to Agents in their Phone apps during ongoing Calls.

Insight cards will only be seen on a ongoing calls and are not stored after Calls are over.

Three types of content can be sent in an Insight Card:

title is a large text. It should describe the name of a custom app.
shortText is a normal line in the Insight Card section.
user is a user card in the Insight Card section displaying the name and availability of the user.

contents.description: Represents lines displayed on the Insight Card

type.description:
Type of line.
Possible values are title, shortText or user (check other tables).

text.description: Text displayed in the line of the Insight Card

link.description: Transform the line in a link.

400.description: Number not found or invalid number to dial.

number_id.description: Unique identifier of the Number to use for the call.

to.description: The number to dial in E.164 format.

post.description:
Outbound calls can be automatically started for a User from their Phone app. It is often used to build a Click-to-call feature!

A Number ID and a phone number to dial must be provided in the request's body.

The User must be available, not on a call and associated to the Number.

Number must be active (validated), inactive numbers can be seen in the Aircall Dashboard.

post.summary: Dial a phone number in the Phone
post.description:
Sending a request to this endpoint will fill the User's Phone app with the to params. They will then be able to start the call within the Phone app and will be free to choose from which Number they want to start the call from. It is often used to build a Click-to-dial feature!

User must be available and not on a call.

This feature is also available from the Aircall Everywhere CTI.

to.description: The phone number to dial in E.164 format.

get.description: Retrieve details of a specific Team.

422.description: Server unable to process the request, error will be described in the troubleshoot field.

delete.description:
When deleting Teams, they will be removed from the Numbers call distribution.

Users and Calls won't be deleted.

post.summary: Add a User to a Team
post.description: Users can be added one by one to a Team.

delete.summary: Remove a User from a Team

422.description: Server unable to process the request, error will be described in the troubleshoot field.

delete.description:
Users can be delete one by one from a Team.

Calls made and received by this User won't be deleted.

get.description: Fetch all Teams associated to a company and their information.

400.description: Company might have reached the maximum number of teams allowed on their plan. Name must be smaller than 64 characters and unique in the company.

post.description:
A name must be provided when creating a Team.

Please use the following endpoint to add Users to it.

get.description:
A User can have only one active Dialer Campaign.

To list all the phone numbers associated to it, please refer to the Retrieve phone numbers endpoint.

422.description: Must include at least one valid phone number.

post.description:
Create an active Dialer Campaign for a User.

A User can have only one active Dialer Campaign.

delete.description:
Dialer Campaign created by Agents or via the Public API can be deleted.

Phone numbers associated to it will be destroyed as well.

get.description: A Dialer Campaign is made of a list of phone numbers. Those lists can be retrieved thanks to the following request.

422.description: Must include at least one valid phone number.

post.description:
Phone numbers can be added to an Agent's active Dialer Campaign.

Those phone numbers will be automatically appended in the Phone app.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the phone number.

delete.description: Delete one phone number from a Dialer Campaign.

get.description: Fetch all Numbers associated to a company and their information.
Retrieve details of a specific Numbers.

put.description: Updates a specific Number. Response will be the updated Number.

availability_status.description: Can be open, custom or closed.

is_ivr.description: If true, Number will be converted into an IVR. Classic otherwise.

live_recording_activated.description: Set to true if you want to enable call recording on the specified Number. It will enable both inbound AND outbound at the same time.

parameters.name: order_by
parameters.description: Set the order field, created_at or updated_at.

get.description: Fetch all the shared Contacts associated to a company with their phone numbers and emails information.

post.description:
Contacts created via Aircall Public API will be automatically shared across the company.

At least a first_name, a last_name OR a company_name is required when creating a Contact.

first_name.description: Can't be blank if defined. Mandatory field if last_name and company_name are empty.

last_name.description: Can't be blank if defined. Mandatory field if first_name and company_name are empty.

phone_numbers.description: Array of phone_numbers objects.For each phone_number, label and value must be set.

emails.description: Array of email address objects. For each email, label and value must be set.

company_name.description: Can't be blank if defined. Mandatory field if first_name and last_name are empty.

get.description: Search within a company's shared Contacts with extra query parameters.

parameters.name: order_by
parameters.description: Set the order field, created_at or updated_at.

get.description:
Retrieve details of a specific Contact.

Only shared contacts can be found.

post.description:
Update a shared Contact. Response will be the updated Contact.

To update a Contact's phone numbers or emails, please use the approriate endpoints described below.

delete.description:
Delete a contact from the Company.

Only shared contacts can be deleted.

post.description: Emails can be added one by one to a Contact.

parameters.name: phoneNumberId
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the phone number.

put.summary: Update a phone number from a Contact
put.description:
Phone number's value will be normalized before being stored.

The value field must be sent each time a phone number is updated.

value.description: Aircall stores any phone number format. It is recommended to store a valid phone number so agent can dial them easily.

delete.description: Phone numbers can be removed from a Contact by using the following endpoint.

parameters.name: email_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the Email address.

put.summary: Update an email from a Contact
put.description: The value field must be sent each time an email address is updated.

delete.summary: Delete an email form a Contact
delete.description: Email addresses can be removed from a Contact by using the following endpoint.

post.summary: Add phone number to a Contact
post.description:
Phone numbers can be added one by one to a Contact.

Phone number's value will be normalized before being stored.

value.description: Aircall stores any phone number format. It is recommended to store a valid phone number so agent can dial them easily.

get.description: Fetch all Tags associated to a company and their information.

post.description: Aircall will perform validation before inserting new Tag (like presence of a name).

color.description: Can't be blank and must ne formatted in hexadecimal

get.description: Retrieve details of a specific Tag.

put.description: Some fields can be updated via the Public API.

color.description: Can't be blank and must be formatted in Hexadecimal.

422.description: Server unable to process the request, error will be described in the troubleshoot field.

delete.description: Tag will be removed from Calls.

get.description: Fetch all Webhooks associated to a company and their information.

post.description: Webhook creation can be done either from the Aircall Dashboard or via the Public API. Webhook have a list of events attached to it, linked to Calls, Users, Contacts and/or Numbers.

url.description: Can't be blank and must be a valid URL.

events.description: If events field is empty, all events will be attached to this webhook.

get.description: Retrieve details of a specific Webhook.

url.description: Can't be blank and must be a valid URL.

events.description: If events field is empty, all events will be attached to this webhook.

active.description: Set this field to true to re-activate a Webhook or false to disable it.

put.description:
Webhook objects can be updated either from the Aircall Dashboard or via the Public API.

This endpoint is also useful to re-activate Webhooks that are automatically disabled by Aircall (more info in the Webhook usage section).

delete.description: Webhook objects can be deleted either from the Aircall Dashboard or via the Public API. Aircall will stop sending events and configuration of the Webhook will be lost.

get.description:
The Company object is a brief representation of the state of a company with its name, the number of Users and Numbers.

Companies are not updatable nor destroyable via Aircall Public API. The only way to do so is via the Aircall Dashboard.

Integration information can be retrieved with this GET request. The return of this endpoint is the integration associated to the accessToken.

This information can only be retrieved for integrations built by aircall, or 3rd party using OAuth. Integrations using Basic Auth arenâ€™t retrievable through this endpoint.

Pagination.description:
When retrieving a list of objects with a [GET] request, results are being paginated by Aircall.

Pagination information will be presented in the meta object, available in the payload body and described below.

from.name: from
from.description: Set a minimal creation date for Users (UNIX timestamp).

to.name: to
to.description: Set a maximal creation date for Users (UNIX timestamp).

order.name: order
order.description: Reorder entries by created_at. Can be asc or desc. Default value is asc.

per_page.name: per_page
per_page.description: Number of results retrieved per page
